title: Research and Markets: Cybersecurity in Smart Buildings Market 2015 - Inaction is No Longer an Option
text:
[September 30, 2015] Research and Markets: Cybersecurity in Smart Buildings Market 2015 - Inaction is No Longer an Option 
Research and Markets ( http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/r36nd6/cybersecurity_in ) has announced the addition of the "Cybersecurity in Smart Buildings " report to their offering. 
Today's smart buildings are increasingly enabled by Internet-of-Things because of the convergence of operational and information technology systems. A host of new elements such as the cloud, remote access, data sharing and analytics, and connected and shared networks has changed how built environments are being used and operated. 
Additionally, these elements have thrown open an otherwise closed-loop building architecture into one that necessitates the open access and control of many operators and service providers, thus making it vulnerable to cyber threat. This research paper looks at the issue of cybersecurity in smart buildings and the steps needed to counter this disruptive trend. 
Key Topics Covered: 
- Background: Cybersecurity Vulnerabilities in Smart Buildings 
- Strategic Messages for the Industry 
- Defining Smart Buildings and Cybersecurity 
- Takeaways 
2. Cyber Risks in Smart Buildings 
- Technology Progression
